metadata.titleEn: The tree ring dataset of populus euphratica in the downstream of the Heihe River
metadata.description: The annual ring is the main technical means for carrying out the variance analysis, and it is also one of the methods to establish the expansion of water consumption time of plant transpiration. In 2001, this project sampled 60 Populus euphratica in Ejin Oasis and measured the age and ring width index.

Verification.Question: Were age and ring width indices determined for 60 Populus euphratica trees in a dataset collected on the Ejina Oasis in 2001?

Concept Completion.Question: What is the primary method used for analyzing changes in tree rings in Populus euphratica along the lower reaches of the Heihe River?

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to analyze the annual growth rings of Populus euphratica trees in an oasis environment?
Example.Answer: A data collection method involves sampling 60 Populus euphratica trees in the Ejina Oasis to determine their age and growth ring width index, as conducted in 2001.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics and methods used for determining tree age and ring width indices in dendrochronology studies?

Quantification.Question: How many trees were sampled for dendrochronological analysis in a dataset related to the field of Populus euphratica along the lower reaches of the Heihe River?

Definition.Question: What does '年轮测定' mean in the context of analyzing tree rings for data collection?
Definition.Answer: In the context of analyzing tree rings for data collection, '年轮测定' refers to the measurement of tree rings, which is a primary technique used for change analysis and one of the methods to establish the time extension of plant transpiration water consumption.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the selection of sampling methods for determining age and ring-width indices in tree-ring data collection?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The selection of sampling methods for determining age and ring-width indices in tree-ring data collection is influenced by the need to perform variability analysis and establish time-extended methods of plant transpiration water consumption, as demonstrated by the 2001 sampling of 60 Populus euphratica trees in the Ejina Oasis.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in collecting tree ring data for analyzing changes and determining the age and growth patterns of poplar trees in arid regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The procedural steps involve sampling 60 poplar trees in the Ejina Oasis, measuring the age and ring width index to conduct change analysis and establish methods for extending the time of plant transpiration water consumption.
